comments:
CDT 200409101437 via our product.

Steps:
1) Mozilla Project Setup  (www.mozilla.org)
2) While compiling the project, I got a compiling error in a file called 
C:\mozilla_workspace\mozilla\xpcom\typelib\xpidl\glib\glib-1.2.1\glib.h 
(attached)

3) So I double-clicked on the error.
    The operation was not successful. It said it could not finish the 
operation.

4) So I went in the C/C++ Project view and drill through the file.
5) I clicked on the '+' in the tree 

I got an out of memory error:

Created an attachment (id=14736)
file where the out of memory error happened

When trying to open glib.h into the editor, the memory goes to 600 MB in 30 
seconds.

I have not been able to reproduce this on the HEAD branch. 
Next I'll check 2_0.
Devin, can you verify/validate this w/Mozilla today?

I can't reproduce this with the latest from CVS HEAD.

Note that it looks like the Mozilla project doesn't contain the glib source 
files anymore (unless it was included in the project explicitly by the user).

Parsing/Indexing the attached source file doesn't cause any Exceptions and my 
memory usage doesn't jump up more than 1-2 MB.

Mathieu,

I am going to mark this as FIXED.  If you get the time, can you try to 
reproduce the bug with the latest integration build found 
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/builds/3.0.0 ?
